author: hung.nguyen
title: Decentralized Auction Platform
description: There is no online auction platform can scientifically guarantee the transparency, honesty of auction result and ensure anonymity of users

f6_assessments.q0: Auction is an activity that has been going on for a long time in the world. There are many types of auctions held. However, sometimes the auctions are not transparent. In addition, many people participated and won the auction but did not fully fulfill their responsibilities and obligations with their auction winning. I believe Decentralized Auction Platform is a good proposal to be able to solve the above problems. Operating a decentralized auction platform will make the auction completely transparent. Successfully operating the auction platform on Cardano will help Cardano apply more to life. In addition, this also gives businesses more confidence when adopting the Cardano platform to operate their businesses, which will attract more businesses to join the Cardano network.
f6_assessments.q1: Do Thi Hong Hanh, Le Minh Tuan or other members of the group are all people with a lot of long-term experience in the same field. This gives me confidence that the team will execute the proposal well. However, I think that in addition to the risks you mentioned and the solutions to deal with, there are some issues that you need to pay attention and solve such as: How can you attract bidders? come to your auction platform because for some items the buyer needs to see it in person. How do you limit the auction participants will drop their deposit when they bid successfully? I think, if some of these problems can be solved, more people will trust and use this auction platform.
f6_assessments.q2: The itinerary you have given is very detailed and complete. This shows that you are very professional and well prepared for the success of this proposal. In addition, I noticed that you also use the amount of $102,984 very transparently and clearly. I greatly appreciate this. The KPI you give is also very clear and complete. Community is easily measurable.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Decentralized Auction Platform" is one of my favorite projects in F8. The proposer presented a vital problem on a relatively large scale. No online auction platform can scientifically guarantee the transparency and truthfulness of the auction results and ensure the anonymity of the users. Correct; auctions are an essential industry in the global economy, there are many auction forms, but each still has many problems to solve. Technology is increasingly developing; decentralization is what we want to aim for. Building a decentralized auction platform on top of the Cardano ecosystem seeks to solve those problems, help promote the development of the auction industry and attract more users to the Cardano platform.
The solution proposed by the proposer identified most of the challenge's concerns and logical arguments. Based on the core issue of auction activities which is transparency, authenticity, and assurance. They pointed out the disadvantages of traditional and online markets. These disadvantages are, in turn, the advantages of a decentralized auction platform.
Every project undertaken is inevitable challenges or risks. The proponent has outlined three main risks and their solutions in great detail. That's a large workload; legal issues, and legal entity. I agree with these possible risks. However, I see that NFT is still not strictly regulated; anyone can create and sell NFT assets, there is no guarantee for its value. This will take risks for the buyer; I hope the team will have an answer for me.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a detailed plan proposal with a clear timeline and specific goals. Consists of 4 phases within 8 months. The project's budget accounted for only 4.1% of the challenge's total budget. Expenses are detailed and precise.
Information about group members is fully given. Ease of identity verification through the links the proponent has updated. They have long experience, professional capacity, and have achieved specific achievements. Each person's work is clearly assigned.
f6_assessments.q2:
Auditing is an essential part of evaluating the success of the project. With this proposal, the proponent introduced KPIs for each specific period. Development progress, financial and accounting statistics will be published on the project website. Each phase of the project will have a public report.
This is a brand new project; it has not been tested. The project's success was determined as successfully building a DApp; attracting the participation of all 3 parties: The auction house, the property owner, and the bidder; Successfully holding 3 sample auctions; and becoming the model DApp for the auction business and a standard example of transforming a traditional business into a decentralized environment.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement in this proposal is clear, and aligns with the challenge question: What needs do users of Cardano have that could be solved by new applications? The proposed solution of building a decentralized auction platform, where bidding actions are conducted by smart contracts using ADA payments is a great way to add utility and value to Cardano. The team proposing this is experienced in operating a large online auction house in Vietnam, and this would be a good pilot project for Cardano to bring in users that may not be familiar with Cardano. There are some other online NFT auction websites, so this would not be the first attempt at building such an online auction, however it may be the first time a large traditional auction house uses Cardano. Funding this proposal could scale to meet future challenges, or provide value to the larger community as it aims to provide open source code that could benefit other businesses and users.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team is well qualified to undertake this project, and they are experienced in the online auction business. The proposal includes the team members and their background in software development and blockchain. It is not clear if they are going to build this entirely with known in-house staff or if they will be hiring developers with experience and specialty in Cardano/Plutus, however the budget includes business consulting, blockchain development and bug bounty, so they are likely to also work with some additional consultants not named in the proposal. 
The budget is clearly broken down into phases, with hourly development rates and total costs. The total budget is a little on the high end, but the timeline is also aggressive to have an android app, IOS app, and web app all working with the blockchain within 4 months.
f6_assessments.q2:
The plan and timeline includes detailed tasks and specific measurable KPI's. Success can be easily determined by the community if they are able to achieve the following goals:

 • Successfully building a decentralized auction platform (DApp) that ensures the transparency and anonymity of the auctions.

• Attracting the participation of all 3 parties, the auction house, the property owner, and the bidder.

• Successfully organize 3 sample auctions.

• Becoming a model DApp for auction business, and a standard example of transforming a traditional business into decentralized environment.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a niche proposal to provide real world users with more blockchain feature. Implementing auction process with smart contracts is truly a great idea! First, I try to find exisiting Decentralized Auction Platform, which is none (exceptional for Blockchain Auction in Polkadot it's totally different with this proposer idea). So if the proposer can implement this idea, it could be the first!

This proposal not explaining what markets they targeted. Proposer just explain the solution of the existing auction platform problem. What will this platform will be used for? NFTs / digital assets or could be for daily business goods like Proposer's auction platform (steels, lands/properties, etc)? I have a concerned if this dApps can be use by worldwide user, how this decentralized auction platform work? Some concept explanation for us (readers) may help us to understand.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team involved here is certainly qualified to carry out the project well; they provide about who they are, their names, a brief history of their backgrounds and previous experiences, and also their LinkedIn profiles, where we can get to know each of them in more detail. And it is a plus thing that one person is a professional in field auction. Budgets are very well explained and seems like realistic for big project like this.

Since proposer not provide any reference or explain that proposer already had a study about this idea, here I find some resources (journal and paper) about the Blockchain-based Auction models: https://www.hindawi.com/journals/scn/2021/5523394/ and  https://arxiv.org/pdf/2110.12534.pdf both were published in 2021. And study about How Efficient the decentralized auction platform: https://gsm.ucdavis.edu/post/how-efficient-are-decentralized-auction-platforms were published in 2020.

I hope that will help your work if this proposal get a funding.
f6_assessments.q2: Their clear project milestone definitely describes the plan and goes beyond the eight-month scope. Appreciate the team to intend all the progress are planned to be open-sourced, and will be published to GitHub. I still have a question regarding the milestone, why there is no marketing timeline for this project while proposer asked $18,840 for business and marketing budgets? Also, what kind of marketing the proposer will use to make success metric no. 2 (Attracting the participation of all 3 parties, the auction house, the property owner, and the bidder) achieved?

f6_assessments.q0: Problem statement There is no online auction platform can guarantee the transparency, honesty of auction result and ensure anonymity of users. Solution, Building a decentralized auction platform, bidding actions are conducted by smart contracts using ADA. Decentralized Auction Platform - where transparency, honesty, anonymity, transaction time will no longer be in the hands of any auction house or minority manipulation group. For auctioned properties such as land, transparency is certified by the responsible authorities, this is why the proponent should add more information or how the law or policy is implemented, in addition. With land, it is necessary to declare the legal owner, so it will be difficult to remain anonymous. The proponent also foresees the risks of legal issues and legal entities that will need time to handle
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent offers 4 stages of development in 8 months with a very detailed roadmap. It will be completed by the end of August (Releasing web, Android, iOS versions / Launching platform on Testnet / Conducting the first 3 online decentralized auctions). The proposal does not mention how the cost plan for successful auctions will be calculated. The proposed cost for the whole project is large and item-by-item proposed with reasonable execution time and unit price for each location. Identity of 6 members as well as professional experience are provided in full
f6_assessments.q2: Deliverable Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are also divided into 4 phases and measured by the release of report documents as well as Android/iOS Apps. Some KPIs are difficult to measure but the team recommends making the source code public at a certain Github address. Anyone can access and check the objectivity and transparency of the system. This is a new project

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal intends to build a decentralized auction platform using smart contracts and ADA transaction to solve problems in untransparency, inhonesty of auction result and user anonymity in traditional online auction. This solution could help to bring more new and viable application on the top of Cardano, help drive the growth of the auction industry and attract more users to the Cardano ecosystem, well aligned to the goals of challenge setting. I just suggest the proposer provides some evidence about the untruthful or cheating in the current online auction, especially some recent scandals in manipulating or pumping the real estate in Thu Thiem district, HCM city  of VietNam. By hence, it will enhance the impactful of proposal in solving the cost of problem.

The Author gave out many challenges/risks that the proposal could encounter during implementation and ways for solving them, this makes the proposal more confidence. But it's better if the Author in-depth review the lack of Auctions on the blockchain standard solutions and violated ability to existing regulations, meanwhile the since June 2020 licensed and certified legal entity for online auction platform will not help much in this new blockchain-based Auction platform.

In common, I appreciate this proposal and hope the proposer will make clear and improve more about its impactful.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has skills relevant to auction, notary, business development, full-stack development, software product manager, blockchain DApps development, UI/UX design with reference Linkedin link and website. But I cannot find any reference relevant to Cardano blockchain in particular. It'll increase the feasibility if the proposer provide a Github repository to show proof of work  and experience on Cardano or Plutus pioneer program. And please note that the current website was built on traditional platform, not based on blockchain technology, so we could not assume it as an MVP of the challenge campaign. It would be better if the Author show a Github sample demo source code. If not, the proposer consider to build a whitepaper detailing the solution.

The proposal provided a detailed plan and rational timeline for delivering the solution, there is a detailed cost breakdown in the proposal that makes sense for the included line items with labor hours and salary. It's a positive point of this proposal. 

As a blockchain solution consultant and long time working in bidding industry, with the auction scheme provided, I realized something are still vague and need deeper explanation, such as: (1) The way/method in encrypting auction participants data similar to e-wallet addresses, (2) How to deal with each transaction and data change from bidder (3) Transaction fee mechanism?

In marketing, I look forward to see more information except marketing budget, I suggest to carry out an advertising campaign to engage the community, especially the enterprises and individuals in auction/bidding industry.

In general, I doubt about the feasibility of this proposal, hope the proposer to prepare more carefully in next Funds.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal's KPIs and other measures of success are auditable, helpful for community tracking how the proposal is progressing with the public source code of the project on Github as promised. I just suggest to make an updated item website or build a telegram/discord channel to interact and update the progress to the community quickly and easily.
The proposal clearly defines what success means with this definition is clearly derived from their KPIs and there is not much things to concern.
Generally, this proposal has enough auditability for the community.

f6_assessments.q0: The presenter of this proposal has met the expectation of this challenge - DApps and Integrations - perfectly. The project proposed by this team has used Cardano solutions such as smart contracts and encrypted information to solve an existing problem - online auction. I do not know if there are any similar services in the market now, but I think this is a creative and on-point project when it comes to the application of Cardano and DApps.
f6_assessments.q1: I'm impressed by the founding team of this project. First of all, all of the members of this team are professionals in relevant fields such as cryptocurrency, auction, software technology, and business operation. As a Vietnamese, I know how massive of the past projects that this team has done. For me, they have proved enough experience to implement this project successfully. The team understands the market clearly, and they have created a creative and applicable solution to the existing problems of the online auction. They have also predicted and admitted possible challenges they may face during real-life implementation. However, the team has a set mind and a clear plan to solve the hardship when they come to it. I believe in this team and this project.
f6_assessments.q2: I think I have all information to predict the progress and success of the proposal. The team has set a clear path to develop this product. The team knows each small goal to conquer to implement this proposal successfully. The profiles of members of this team are provided in full. The plan and timeline for the project are explained in detail, and the budget breakdown is informative and reasonable. All technical aspects of this project are analyzed carefully, and as a developer, I love to see all those things. However, I wish the presenter had included a link to the  project's GitHub, as I love to see the project's progression in terms of technology.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a highly viable proposition that effectively solves the challenge. It is a decentralized auction platform – where the transparency, honesty, anonymity, transaction time will no be longer in the hands of any auction house or minority manipulator group (all bid orders and transactions are based on smart contracts, members' account information is encrypted , the system source code is public on the project's Github). This will certainly attract a large number of people participating in the auction, thereby increasing the number of people participating in the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team consists of members with a lot of knowledge, skills and experience in different fields: auction, justice, blockchain, dapp,... Each has their own strengths, they combine to create into a strong team. Besides, they have been working in important positions, they have achieved many specific successes: operating and managing Lac Viet Auction Partnership, Managing Director – Media.Monks,.... Easily check the transparency of team information thanks to the contacts you have provided. As you know, the team is an important factor determining the success or failure of a project. The above information is a clear proof, I believe that your team is fully capable of implementing the project.
You have identified the risks and ways to reduce it, I appreciate it. The roadmap is specifically defined through 4 phases, the tasks to be performed in each stage are also listed in detail. The budget is allocated quite reasonably, you have calculated the budget based on the number of hours worked, the salary per hour, this helps to increase the transparency of the budget. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) are already provided, however, it would be nice if they included specific numbers, e.g. in the first auction there will be 20 participants,...
f6_assessments.q2:
This is a potential project, because auctions are an extremely important industry in the global economy. The system is designed to be easy to use and operate, enable the organization of online auctions to become simple, convenient to both buyers and sellers. This is model example of digital transformation for the auction business.
The information provided is sufficient for us to comment and evaluate its success. I am also Vietnamese, I also know a little about Lac Viet Auction Partnership, this makes me more confident about your project. I hope this project will be funded, it will bring great value to our ecosystem.
